00032 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00038 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00039 uint8_t menu[]=
00040         "*******************************************************************************\n\r"
00041         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00042         "CAN demo \n\r"
00043         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00044         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00045         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00046         "Use two CAN peripherals: CAN1 and CAN2 to communicate\n\r"
00047         "Use CAN frames to control LED display\n\r"
00048         "*******************************************************************************\n\r";
00049 
00051 CAN_MSG_Type TXMsg, RXMsg; // messages for test Bypass mode
00052 uint8_t LED_Value;
00053 uint32_t LED[8] = {(1<<6),(1<<5),(1<<4),(1<<3),(1<<2),(1<<31),(1<<29),(1<<28)};
00054

00056 void CAN_IRQHandler(void);

00058 void CAN_InitMessage(void);

00060 
00061 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00062 /*********************************************************************/
00067 void CAN_IRQHandler()
00068 {
00069         uint8_t IntStatus;
00070         uint32_t data,i;
00071         /* get interrupt status
00072          * Note that: Interrupt register CANICR will be reset after read.
00073          * So function "CAN_IntGetStatus" should be call only one time
00074          */
00075         IntStatus = CAN_IntGetStatus(LPC_CAN2);
00076         //check receive interrupt
00077         if((IntStatus>>0)&0x01)
00078         {
00079                 CAN_ReceiveMsg(LPC_CAN2,&RXMsg);
00080                 data = RXMsg.dataA[0];
00081                 for(i=0;i<8;i++)
00082                 {
00083                         if ((data >> i)&0x01)
00084                         {
00085                                 if(i<5)
00086                                         GPIO_SetValue(2,LED[i]);
00087                                 else
00088                                         GPIO_SetValue(1,LED[i]);
00089                         }
00090                         else
00091                         {
00092                                 if(i<5)
00093                                         GPIO_ClearValue(2,LED[i]);
00094                                 else
00095                                         GPIO_ClearValue(1,LED[i]);
00096                         }
00097                 }
00098 
00099         }
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS----------------------------*/
00103 /*********************************************************************/
00108 void CAN_InitMessage(void) {
00109         TXMsg.format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00110         TXMsg.id = 0x00001234;
00111         TXMsg.len = 8;
00112         TXMsg.type = DATA_FRAME;
00113         TXMsg.dataA[0] = TXMsg.dataA[1] = TXMsg.dataA[2] = TXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00114         TXMsg.dataB[0] = TXMsg.dataB[1] = TXMsg.dataB[2] = TXMsg.dataB[3] = 0x00000000;
00115 
00116         RXMsg.format = 0x00;
00117         RXMsg.id = 0x00;
00118         RXMsg.len = 0x00;
00119         RXMsg.type = 0x00;
00120         RXMsg.dataA[0] = RXMsg.dataA[1] = RXMsg.dataA[2] = RXMsg.dataA[3] = 0x00000000;
00121         RXMsg.dataB[0] = RXMsg.dataB[1] = RXMsg.dataB[2] = RXMsg.dataB[3] = 0x00000000;
00122 }
00123 
00124 /*********************************************************************/
00129 void print_menu()
00130 {
00131         _DBG(menu);
00132 }
00133 
00134 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00135 /*********************************************************************/
00140 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00141         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00142         uint32_t test;
00143 
00144         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00145          * – 115200bps
00146          * – 8 data bit
00147          * – No parity
00148          * – 1 stop bit
00149          * – No flow control
00150          */
00151         debug_frmwrk_init();
00152         print_menu();
00153 
00154         /* LED setting */
00155         GPIO_SetDir(1,(1<<28)|(1<<29)|(1<<31),1);
00156         GPIO_SetDir(2,(1<<2)|(1<<3)|(1<<4)|(1<<5)|(1<<6),1);
00157 
00158         /* Pin configuration
00159          * CAN1: select P0.0 as RD1. P0.1 as TD1
00160          * CAN2: select P2.7 as RD2, P2.8 as RD2
00161          */
00162         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00163         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00164         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00165         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00166         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00167         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00168         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00169         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00170 
00171         PinCfg.Pinnum = 7;
00172         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00173         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00174         PinCfg.Pinnum = 8;
00175         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00176 
00177         //Initialize CAN1 & CAN2
00178         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN1, 125000);
00179         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN2, 125000);
00180 
00181         //Enable Interrupt
00182         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN2, CANINT_RIE, ENABLE);
00183         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF,CAN_AccBP);
00184         CAN_InitMessage();
00185 
00186         //Enable CAN Interrupt
00187         NVIC_EnableIRQ(CAN_IRQn);
00188         while(1)
00189         {
00190                 _DBG("Press LED value that you want to display \n\r"
00191                           "This value should be in range from 0x00 to 0xFF: ");
00192 loop:
00193                 LED_Value = 0;
00194                 test = _DG;
00195                 switch(test)
00196                 {
00197                 case '0': LED_Value = 0; break;
00198                 case '1': LED_Value = 1; break;
00199                 case '2': LED_Value = 2; break;
00200                 case '3': LED_Value = 3; break;
00201                 case '4': LED_Value = 4; break;
00202                 case '5': LED_Value = 5; break;
00203                 case '6': LED_Value = 6; break;
00204                 case '7': LED_Value = 7; break;
00205                 case '8': LED_Value = 8; break;
00206                 case '9': LED_Value = 9; break;
00207                 case 'A': LED_Value = 0x0A; break;
00208                 case 'a': LED_Value = 0x0A; break;
00209                 case 'B': LED_Value = 0x0B; break;
00210                 case 'b': LED_Value = 0x0B; break;
00211                 case 'C': LED_Value = 0x0C; break;
00212                 case 'c': LED_Value = 0x0C; break;
00213                 case 'D': LED_Value = 0x0D; break;
00214                 case 'd': LED_Value = 0x0D; break;
00215                 case 'E': LED_Value = 0x0E; break;
00216                 case 'e': LED_Value = 0x0E; break;
00217                 case 'F': LED_Value = 0x0F; break;
00218                 case 'f': LED_Value = 0x0F; break;
00219                 default:
00220                         _DBG_("\n\rInvalid input, please type again!");
00221                         goto loop;
00222                 }
00223                 test = _DG;
00224                 switch(test)
00225                 {
00226                 case '0': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0; break;
00227                 case '1': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|1; break;
00228                 case '2': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|2; break;
00229                 case '3': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|3; break;
00230                 case '4': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|4; break;
00231                 case '5': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|5; break;
00232                 case '6': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|6; break;
00233                 case '7': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|7; break;
00234                 case '8': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|8; break;
00235                 case '9': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|9; break;
00236                 case 'A': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0A; break;
00237                 case 'a': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0A; break;
00238                 case 'B': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0B; break;
00239                 case 'b': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0B; break;
00240                 case 'C': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0C; break;
00241                 case 'c': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0C; break;
00242                 case 'D': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0D; break;
00243                 case 'd': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0D; break;
00244                 case 'E': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0E; break;
00245                 case 'e': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0E; break;
00246                 case 'F': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0F; break;
00247                 case 'f': LED_Value = (LED_Value<<4)|0x0F; break;
00248                 default:
00249                         _DBG_("\n\rInvalid input, please type again!");
00250                         goto loop;
00251                 }
00252                 _DBH32(LED_Value);_DBG_("");
00253                 _DBG_("Display LED... ");_DBG_("");
00254                 TXMsg.dataA[0] = LED_Value;
00255                 CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &TXMsg);
00256         }
00257         return 1;
00258 }
00259 
00260 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00261  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00262  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00263  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00264  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00265 int main(void) {
00266         return c_entry();
00267 }
